page.title: 01East and West Buckland
page.content: Our area is mainly agricultural with some woodland.Most houses are very old and most of the farms existed for centuries.Most farms are pastoral,raising sheep and cows for meat and keeping dairy cows.On the steeper slopes many of the farmers have planted trees which are sold to a local sawmill. East and West Buckland are the only villages in our area.They both have a church.There is a store and a garage in West Buckland,East Buckland has a resturant but no shop. West Buckland School is a public school with a prep department.The School was founded in 1861.The school has 450 pupils.The school has 35 acres of ground. Alexander Fearon Bruce Symons
